fields.description:
The instructions for building JIRA 3.12.3 specify incorrect command-line options for maven.  Here's the page:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.12.3/building.html

The documentation suggests using the following command-line options:

maven -Djira.build.bundle.plugins=false include-rpc-plugin war:webapp

This results in a build error.  As far as I can tell, the maven syntax should actually be:

maven -Djira.build.bundle.plugins=false -Dinclude-rpc-plugin=false war:webapp

While you're there, it would also be nice to give some tip about setting an alternate repo to work around the lack of support for redirects in Maven 1.0.x:

http://blogs.atlassian.com/developer/2006/12/maven_1_repository_changes.html

Anyway, the new documentation looks great, wish there were a quick link to leave feedback like this, though... :)
fields.summary: Documentation specifies incorrect  maven build syntax.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15362].
  {panel}

Currently to perform low level mail debugging you have to set mail.debug=true on the command line and restart JIRA.

We should be able to toggle a switch in the logging section of JIRA and have it turn on dynamically.

Ideally one should only have to set System.getProperties().setProperty*"mail.debug","true") however there is a block on this

In order to get this to work, atlassian-mail needs some surgery as decsribed here: 

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MAIL-38

Also in the IMAP/POP fetcher we dont use the same mechanism but instead rely on javax.mail.Session.getDefaultInstance() which is a static.  We need to call setDebug() on this object before using it.

After that we should be able to get dynamic mail debugging in place without a restart.
fields.summary: Add dynamic mail.debug support to JIRA

fields.description:
If there is an existing user in JIRA e.g. _jond_ with the email address written in lower cases e.g. _jondo@mycomp.com_ and he sends email from mail client config with mixed cases e.g _JonDo@mycomp.com_. When the mailhandler processes the messages, it fails to match the sender with the existing JIRA user.

Additionally, JIRA sends to _Forward_ similar a similar error message:

{noformat}
This is an automated email from the issue creation service at "https://support.atlassian.com".

An error was encountered whilst handling messages from the mail server
"confluence-support-system@ (Confluence support emails)" using the handler "class com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateOrCommentHandler".

The error was:
------------------------
"jond" does not have permission to comment on an issue in project: 10001"
------------------------

The error and the email that caused the error are attached to this email.

If this is a recurring problem, you may wish to contact a system administrator to check the parameters of your mail fetching service:
https://support.atlassian.com/secure/Administrators.jspa
{noformat}
fields.summary: CreateOrComment mail handler is case sensitive when it matches email address

fields.description:
Hi,

To improve the migration importation phase from mantis I made some modifications to the importer MantisImportBean reusing some modifications that was already made in another issue and some modifications that was existing for bugzilla importer. 

I also add the same search bugzilla portlet as for mantis.

Please find attached a zip file with the following new file :

- mantis.vm
- mantissearch.jsp
- corner_mantisfinder.gif
- mantisfinder.gif
- mantis*.properties (for i18n)

And one file that was patched : 
- system-portlets-plugin.xml

Those files are placed in the same directory as in my development installation, it provides a fast search portlet to find an issue given its mantis id.

There is also the file : MantisImportBean.java 

To add this file, I use the http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Standalone+quick+source+modifications 

The importer was modified to do the following : 

- create specific custom fields : internal priority and reproducibility. Those fields exist in mantis but they wasn't imported in JIRA with the original importer.
- the importer could now made incremental import
- create links type : duplicate, related to, child of 
- recreate Links between issue (only if the two issues exist. In case of partial import, the link will be created when all issues are present)
- import watchers

I will link to the issue that helps me to modify the importer.


I hope it could be helpful if it is integrated in the core.

Regards,
fields.summary: Improve mantis migration and integration (patch attached)
Add Support for Right to Left Languages

fields.description: We use JIRA to run our IT Help Desk and have configured an e-mail address to which employees can send IT requests/log help tickets. It would be very beneficial if JIRA could automatically assign issues to either a component or role (workflow plugin, should we choose to install it) when issues are created via e-mail. The problem we are experiencing is that issues are frequently neglected, or "fall through the cracks," so to speak, because they are not automatically assigned to specific individuals who are capable of resolving them.

fields.description:
Currently the order to create an issue security level is:

* Creating an Issue Security Scheme
* Setting the Default Security Level for an Issue Security Scheme
* Adding a Security Level to an Issue Security Scheme

But it is not possible to Set the default level before you add the security level first! So please change the order to:

* Creating an Issue Security Scheme
* Adding a Security Level to an Issue Security Scheme
* Setting the Default Security Level for an Issue Security Scheme

This applies to both the menu on the left and the actual documentation on the right.
fields.summary: wrong order on Issue Security Schemes

fields.description:
In SAC there are about [30 cases|https://support.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&&query=MS+AND+SQL+AND+2005&summary=true&description=true&body=true&pid=10000&created%3Aprevious=-24w] created in last 6months related to MS SQL 2005.

Significant number is related to the configuration of MS SQL. It seems that the customers don't have enough experience in managing they own database server and are unable to set up the JIRA database correctly.

Since in most cases the windows administrators need "special" care, this document should guide them step by step through the set up process.

Instructions at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/databases/sqlserver.html and the improvements from  [JRA-13799|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-13799] seem to be not sufficient enough for some admins. :(
fields.summary: Create step-by-step instruction on creation of JIRA database in MS SQL 2005

fields.description:
In edit templates the entire table row (including the field name/label) is generated for the edit view using the controlHeader and controlFooter calls.  This allows for the entire row to customized.  I use this in a custom field plugin for fields that can only be seen by users with certain permissions (similar to how comments are handled).

In the view template, however, only the field's value is rendered.  This requires Jira source to be modified to achieve the same effect of hiding the entire row.  I think it would be a fairly simple change to allow the view template to render the label as well.  This would allow for plugins to create "field level permissions" more effectively and allow for say, HTML acronym tags to be embedded in the label.
fields.summary: Use same method for rendering fields in view templates as in edit templates

It's suspected by those involved in investigating that the problem was because the remote API did not enforce the selection of a Resolution Status

fields.description:
The login portlet is not displayed when the default dashboard has no portlets. Under 3.12.x it actually gives the user the link to add a portlet. Under 3.13 it actually displays nothing (check the attached screeshots). This is a large problem under 3.12.x because the login link in the header goes to the dashboard. Under 3.13 I believe the login link takes you directly to the static jsp.

Also, the width of the login portlet seems to depend upon the layout of the system dashboard. If the system dashboard has 1 column, then the portlet will take up the whole screen. When it has two columns, the login portlet only takes up half the screen (check screenshots).
fields.summary: Login 'portlet' not being displayed.

fields.description:
I refer to JSP-26224.

Project roles are defined globally in JIRA. But in each project ALL project roles are visible in administrator view, even if they are not in use. The project administrators get confused if the number of project roles increases...

Project Roles should be dynamically added to projects.
So that in a project only the roles can be seen 
* which are in use in the workflow which is associated to the project 
* and which are in use in the permission scheme
* and whch are in use in the notification scheme
fields.summary: Project Roles should be dynamically added to projects.

fields.description:
Jira sends email notifications with "Precedence: bulk" email header to prevent auto-reply messages.
But our corporate email system uses "Auto-submitted: auto-generated" email header instead and doesn't respect "Precedence: bulk".

http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc3834.html
http://trac.edgewall.org/ticket/5288

It seems it makes sense to use both.
fields.summary: Add "Auto-submitted" header to all email notifications to prevent "Out Of Office" messages

fields.description:
In the new JIRA Issues Macro for confluence, we're trying to allow users to sort and page on the fly, via ajax. We're doing that by changing and appending things in the URL, like a new sort order, or a new pager/start variable. This works well for normal JIRA Issue Filter URLs, like this one:

  http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?pid=10240&fixfor=13194&resolution=-1&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=200

However, if you try to get a URL from a saved filter, you get a URL like this:

  http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/16317/SearchRequest-16317.xml?tempMax=200

New sort orders on _this_ URL are simply ignored, and the results returned in the original order. For example:

  http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/16317/SearchRequest-16317.xml?sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=ASC&tempMax=200

Parameters on the URL should override the default settings of a saved filter.
fields.summary: Saved Filter URLs do not respect additional parameters

The Mail Server screen actually makes it sound as if you can configure Multiple SMTP Servers.  Also it would be nice if the email prefix could be configured per Project or Issue Type.

Thanks
fields.summary: Should be able to configure multiple SMTP servers

fields.description:
When you are a non-sys admin and want to send a support request you will see the following message.

The message is "You do not have permission to access Trusted Application info. Contact your System Administrator."

This is a bit uninformative, perhaps we should show a warning that the trusted app info will not be shown but showing an error is a bit alarming.
fields.summary: When sending a support request as a non system admin there is a message about not being able to see trusted app information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15299].
  {panel}

Many peoples get themselves into "bizarre" problems, when they restore a xml backup of the production into a test JIRA instance and start to receive "weird" emails.

Users create support request in SAC and blame JIRA for:
- notification emails on "ghost"/not existing  issues,
- duplicated notification and subscription messages,
- outdated content of the subscription messages.

Quotes from SAC cases:
{quote}
For instance, if I send an email to help@mycomp.com it will create a ticket in jira... sometimes it will create it as TS-5769 (The proper ticket number), and other times it would be TS-5716 (an outdated ticket). The email that we receive as a notification stating the ticket was created seems fine, it has all the information that was submitted (except for the ticket number), but when you click on the link (ticket number), it will be an outdated ticket.... It's very strange! 
{quote}
and one more about subscription:
{quote}
One of our users had a subscription set up that she had deleted, along with the filter used for the subscription, so both of these no longer exist. The subscription is still being sent on the schedule she had set up, and it's always the same old data. I posted a message on the forum but their ideas have not worked. Can anyone help me with this? I don't think there has been any info in the log on it, but I'll attach those just in case, along with one of the email subscriptions that was just sent last night.
{quote}

Perhaps JIRA should:
- on the Import page give option to manually enable the services after the restore, but by default disable them,
- after restore list all disabled services,
- display warning in the UI that services are disabled,
- allow to manually enable the single services from the UI.
fields.summary: Disable mail services after xml restore of JIRA backup to another instance

fields.description:
Currently jira allows one to setup notification schemes and roles in such a way e-mails can be sent to large groups. For example, a notification scheme refers to the developers role, and the developers role contains jira-users. On a large instance (100's of projects, 1000's of users) this would produce a lot of unintentional e-mails. Even with proper user training, on an instance of this size it will happen 'accidentally' quite frequently.

Modify jira so it will warn a user when they are creating a situation that may lead jira to generate 100's of e-mails, as this is most likely not what the user wants.
fields.summary: Warn users before sending e-mail to jira-users, or other large groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15297].
  {panel}

Each Workflow step can have Conditions, Validators, or Post-Functions associated with them.  Having these features associated with the Clone and Edit operations would allow easier manipulation and greater control of issues:

- Associate a permission with the Clone permission to restrict who can clone on a per-project (or global) basis
- Add a Clone post-function to delete certain fields that would be undesirable
- Check the value of a certain field is populated after an edit (or process the field contents)

In my particular use case, I wish to see a series of custom fields be cleared out when an Issue is cloned from another.
fields.summary: Add Conditions, Validators, Post Functions  to the Clone, Edit operations
Add the ability to copy a custom field context
Not allowed to get a result set of more than 100 results

fields.description:
The current documentation on [Creating Issues and Comments from Email|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issue_creation_email.html] : [Handler Parameters|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issue_creation_email.html#handler_params] says:

{quote}
*ccassignee*
If an email has a Cc address listing a user already present in JIRA, by default JIRA will *assign* the issue created from the email to that user. If you do not want this behaviour, set *ccassignee* to *false*.
{quote}

The name *ccassignee* is misleading as it indicates a relationship with email's CC field, however JIRA uses all fields (To, Cc, Bcc) when performing a lookup for an assignable user. Therefore the message should say something along the following lines:

bq. If an email's  *To*, *Cc*, or *Bcc* field (in this order) has any address listing a user already present in JIRA, by default JIRA will *assign* the issue created from the email to that user. If you do not want this behaviour, set *ccassignee* to *false*.
fields.summary: Incorrect description of the ccassignee parameter for Create or Comment Handler

fields.description:
Another filter displayed when edit current one.

Steps to reproduce:

1. open two different saved filters in two tabs of the browser (or two windows of the same browser).
2. click "Edit" link on the page with filter opened first(!)

Expected result:
ability to edit the filter opened first

Obtained result:
you are editing the last opened filter (from the second tab)

Workaround:
replace "mode=hide" with "mode=show" in the filter link http://jira.jnetx.ru/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=show&requestId=10533
requestId required to edit the current filter.

I suppose you have to add "requestId=xxxxx" to the "Edit" link when some filter is opened.
Thank you.
fields.summary: Another filter displayed when edit current one

fields.description:
In step 2 of the CSV wizard, when we show you a "Corresponding JIRA field" list of JIRA system fields the text that we show in the dropdown is i18n'ed incorrectly. It is initialized in a static block in CsvConfigBean. This means that the translation will only be done once and it will be done into the default language that is setup for JIRA (since at the time of translation there is no user).

This is wrong we should translate those once for each page render.

To reproduce this bug:
# set your default language to Russian (or any non-english language)
# Go to the CSV import and see that the field names are in Russian
# Change the default language back to English, the field names will always be Russian until JIRA is restarted.
fields.summary: All the field translations in the CsvConfigBean are set only once on startup and are set to the systems default language

fields.description:
On http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/enterprise_to_pro.html

Line that says:
Also ensure that in the permission schemes and notification schemes, only 'groups' or 'project roles' are specified (i.e., no 'Current Reporter', 'Single User', 'Project Lead' or 'Current Assignee'). 

Should say something similar to:

Also ensure that in the permission schemes only 'groups' or 'project roles' are specified and notification schemes don't use 'Component Lead'.
fields.summary: incorrect info on the Ent to Pro Downgrad page

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Go to the CSV import page (/secure/admin/views/CsvImporter!default.jspa)
# Enter "foo+bar" into the "CSV Import file" field.
# Click the "Import Wizard" link

The "CSV Import file" field on the next page will contain "foo bar", indicating that the filename has not been URL encoded during the transition.
fields.summary: CSV file path corrupted (not URL encoded) when starting CSV import wizard

fields.description:
I am asking for a more logical and consistent sort of status columns when doing a two-dimentional filter statistics portlet.

Currently, when I choose Status for one of the sides of the portlet, the bug statuses are listed as follows:

Resolved
Closed
(Bug) Open - Review
(Bug) Work - Waiting
(Bug) Work - In Work
(Bug) Work - Rework
(Bug) Deferred - Review

When I do one for Admin Tasks instead of bugs, the order of the Status columns is:

Resolved
Closed
(Admin task) Open - Review
(Admin Task) Work - Rework
(Admin Task) Work - In Work
(Admin Task) Permission Needed
(Admin Task) Work - Waiting

Notice the difference between bugs and admin tasks? It should sort with the workflow so that the columns are in order (regardless of whether or not it's a bug or an admin task):

Open - Review
Work - Waiting
Work - In Work
Work - Rework
Resolved
Closed
fields.summary: Sort the status columns in a two-dimentional filter statistics portlet

User creates an issue using this jelly script:

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib"><jira:Login username="dykew" password="********"><jira:CreateIssue priority="Major" updated="2008-03-17 12:14:00.0" description="test description" project-key="TTP" issueIdVar="issueid" issueKeyVar="issuekey" summary="test summary" environment="Live Site/Production" created="2007-11-09 01:22:00.0" issueType="Defect"><jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_10080" value="33951"/></jira:CreateIssue></jira:Login></JiraJelly>

I reset users password.

Ran the script and received message that the script ran. Then search for the issue that the script created. Issue not found.
Customers xml backup attached
fields.summary: User creates an issue using Jelly. Then searches for issue and it cannot be found

fields.description: The 'Change history' label is incorrectly translated into Spanish as 'Cambiar Historial'. It should be translated as 'Histórico de cambios'
fields.summary: Bad translation of 'Change history' in Spanish internationalisation package

fields.description:
Description:
In: "Administer Project", the second box is for "Components" management.  The component lead is one individual.  I'd like to request adding the ability to specify a group not just one person.

Justification:
We use JIRA on my team to provide support to designers.  Our component can be a single "tool" or a "category".  Regardless, often times, it's not just a single person who is supporting a particular "component"; it could be several people. I'd like to have the option of specifying a "group" (not just one person) in the "Lead" field so that issues are routed to that group automatically as they are filed, and not just to the "Lead".   In the absence of such feature, the "Lead" would have to continuously direct traffic and reassign issues to individual users.  This is unnecessary and time consuming.  We would like for JIRA to save us this time.

Thanks and regards,
Eddie Sneeh
Marvell Semiconductor
fields.summary: Add ability to specify a group as a "Lead" for a component

fields.description: We are in  need of adding a new button on the sceen of creating a new issue. Are  there  possible ways to do this?
fields.summary: how to add a new button on the sceen of creating a new issue

fields.description: When looking at sub-tasks in the Issue Navigator or in dashboard portlets, it would be helpful to list not only the JIRA ID the subtask is underneath, but the task summary.  Currently, a user can mouseover the task JIRA ID to read the task summary, but it would be much more human-readable if the mouseover wasn't necessary.
fields.summary: Sub-task summary in Issue Navigator should display task's summary (not just task's JIRA ID)

fields.description:
When looking at an issue there are a number of links under the "Operations" heading.  Almost all of these are one line with a link to that operation.  'Worklog' is not a link, and users have to click on the link the next line down that says "Log work done".  This has been confusing every time a new user has started working in JIRA.

Thanks,
Tim
fields.summary: Would prefer if the "Worklog" heading under "Operations" when viewing an issue were a link, like the rest of the operations.

fields.description:
The current title used in an RSS feed is just the name of the JIRA installation, which doesn't help to differentiate between feeds. A better title would be something to do with the content "Open issues in the project 'My Project'"

Equally, the current description in a generated RSS feed is, "An XML representation of a search request", which is kind of unhelpful.

It would be nice if something more user friendly was used like: "A feed containing the results of a search request", or even better a language description of the  search parameters "A feed containing all open issues in the project 'My Project'".
fields.summary: Improve title and description of RSS feed

fields.description: Would like to have a "Enabled" flag for each issue link type so that if someone wants to stop using a specific issue link then it can be disabled but all instances of the link within issues are maintained. Currently only option is to delete which then allows you to either re-assign the link type to another link type or delete but would be great if it can just be disabled instead to prevent people linking any more issues with the specific link type.
fields.summary: Issue Links - Ability to disable specific links

fields.description:
If one uses the JIRA standalone exe installer to install JIRA on Windows 2008, the installer doesn't present an option to configure and install the JIRA windows service during the installation process.

However, the JIRA service can be successfully installed by manual execution of  _service.bat install_.
fields.summary: Windows installer doesn't allow to install JIRA service as windows service on Windows 2008
Delete Attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15260].
  {panel}

Like a filter subscription, Is there any way by that we can subscribe for

1) Dashboard
2) Pie Chart
3) Excel formatted Jira issue report
4) Two dimension filter static

The requirement is that user want a report that should run periodically 8 hrs, and the report should show,
1) Total issue updated by team in the last 8 hrs with issue no.
2) Total issue updated by individual team member in the last 8 hrs with issue number.

To do this, the user thought of configuring a pie chart and 2D filter and subscribe this dashboard for mail Notification, but JIRA does not support this functionality at the moment.
fields.summary: Add ability to subscribe dashboards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15259].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA doesn't allow to move a sub-task from one project to another.

If you try to perform this operation you get the following error:

bq. Cannot link Parent issue from a different project

This task can be performed in a few separate steps.
# Convert sub-task to issue.
# Move newly created issue to other project
# Convert it to sub-task in destination project
fields.summary: It should be possible to move sub-task from parent issue in one project to a parent issue in another project

fields.description:
This sentence:

Use this form to edit a comments body and security level.

...should read:

Use this form to edit a comment's body and security level.
fields.summary: on the 'Edit Comment' screen, the word 'comments' needs an apostrophe

fields.description:
I modified my log4j.properties file, it now contains the line

log4j.appender.filelog.File=${catalina.home}/logs/atlassian-jira.log

and the log file is properly generated in Tomcat's /logs directory.

But JIRA can't find it. The System Information page and the Support Request page both contain the error message "Could not find atlassian-jira.log in current working directory".

Of course JIRA should not look in the current working directory, it should look whereever the property log4j.appender.filelog.File points to.
fields.summary: Could not find atlassian-jira.log

fields.description:
A few points:
* A few times it says to set up a second test instance with "Configure your new JIRA to have the same configuration as your old JIRA".
  Actually, it had better point to a different database schema, else all hell will break loose.
  Also it needs a different Lucene index directory.
  These are kind of covered later, but I worry that a user may get confused.
* It tries to explain the "XML upgrade" method, and "DB upgrade" method together, whereas I think each should be explained separately even if this means some duplication.
* Note that the instructions generally refer to setting up a test instance on the same box as the prod instance. It should be noted that better practice is to use a separate box if possible.
* It seems to mostly explain setting up a test upgrade, rather actually doing a real upgrade, but it is not clear which is which.
* Section 5.2 "Post-startup checks and tasks", seems to be a mix-up of some final things to do when setting up a test instance, and tasks to change over the test to production.
* "If you changed machines when upgrading, change the paths to the indexes, attachments and backup directories, from within the Administration section of JIRA."
  Actually, if you installed on a different machine, you may be able to use the same directories, however on the same machine you will definitely need to change these.
fields.summary: The JIRA upgrade guide is misleading

fields.description:
The JIRA upgrade at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/upgrading.html has an error in Section 2. Configure your new JIRA to have the same configuration as your old JIRA.
I think the second time it is actually referring to jira-application.properties.

Also there is no mention of what is probably the most important file to change:
server.xml on Standalone JIRA where you set up your DB configuration settings.
fields.summary: Duplicate explanation of entityengine.xml in the upgrade guide.
WebWork performance problems on issues Navigator

fields.description:
Road map now contains a green-red progress bar indicating unresolved and resolved amount of work for a particular release. It can be also useful to see which part of planned issues is "in progress", i.e. these issues are "expected to be done soon" (important mainly for testers and project manages). This can be seen now only on per-issue basis, and might be incorporated also in progress bar indicator.

Yes, it is only an adornment, but it can
# do a reasonable amout of information very quickly, 
# be easy to implement as far as it requires to modify only a pretty local part of code and all necessary information are (likely) already available in runtime, _and_
# provide a nice screenshot fragment for release notes and it always makes marketing happy. :-)
fields.summary: Add yellow part for in progress issues into progress bar of roadmap.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
- Create a user with i18n characters, such as username: の中, full name:  の中国語学習資料をお送
- Click *Project Roles* link for this user in user browser
- Click *Edit Project Roles* link on View Project Roles page
- Choose a project and some roles, click *Save* button
- Notice that *name* paramenter in the browser url is now incorrect, e.g. {{.../secure/admin/user/ViewUserProjectRoles.jspa?name=n-&returnUrl=ViewUser.jspa}}
- Clicking any user-related link (*Edit Project Roles* or *<< Return to viewing user ''*) will produce an error *{color:red}This user does not exist please select a user from the user browser.{color}*
